Package no.ntnu.idatt1001.common.menu

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idatt1001.common.menu.Menu
public class Menu extends Object
A class representing a menu for user interface functionality. The menu class is able to navigate through an ItemRegister object provides the user the ability to modify the register's item list.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
10124

  • Constructor Details

    • Menu

      public Menu(ItemRegister itemRegister)
      A constructor for the Menu class. Creating an instance requires an ItemRegister object which will be used through the menu object. An object of the Scanner class is also initialized for getting user input.
      Parameters:
      itemRegister - The ItemRegister which the menu will be navigating through

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      The start method which is used to start the whole menu user interface. The program enters an indefinite while loop while the menu is running. The user is prompted to input an index which corresponds to the index number of the specific menu option in MenuOption. This user input is achieved by using the Scanner class and the implementation of the UserInput interface. The selectMenu(MenuOption) method is called inside the loop as long as the application is running.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      A standard to-string method for displaying all the specified menu options.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string formatted with all the menu options specified
